sentences: Tulekahjus hÃ¤vis sadu hektareid noort metsa.
context: The Estonian word 'sada' is a numeral that means 'hundred' or the number 100. It can be used to count exactly one hundred items, refer to large quantities approximately (meaning many/multiple hundreds), and appears in various compound numbers like kaheksasada (800) or nelisada (400). The word has different grammatical forms including saja (genitive), sadad (nominative plural), sajast (elative), and other case endings depending on how it's used in a sentence.
